CHAT.comment: you can tell what Chi's name is since one of the people he's writing to has the same name
BCN Dear Brian , Dear Christopher , Dear Nikki , Hi! I miss you. Love , Chris

Chi first attempt at a letter is to write out the alphabet. Mot then is able to get Chi on task to write a real letter. Mot gives Chi most of the ideas for the letter and Chi goes along with her. Chi decides to write to three friends of his. Although she must also give spellings of words , MOT emphasizes punctuation , capital letters , indenting , and other aspects of letter writing. Sometimes she takes the pencil from him to erase something. Chi often has to erase what he wrote but only once does he get frustrated. Mot helps Chi with spelling and sometimes asks him to sound out a word. Mot suggests a couple of different things to write in the letter and Chi chooses one of them. Mot has Chi read back parts of letter , then he reads the whole thing back at the end. The activity runs smoothly but is lengthy.

u.a: starts writing or copying the alphabet
Chi has an idea , then he stops to think
Chi had started writing alphabet on first page
the final result is an erased lowercase d and <Dear> written with a capital , indented from the erased part
takes the pencil and then gives it back
Chi erasing and blowing it away
takes away the eraser from Chi
tries to show Chi how to indent
lays his head on the table
Chi has laid head back on the table
points to the o and smiles at EXP
erases c and writes a capital c
